result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel F. Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

With Good Time Credit.
Concurrent with: 15CM449 & 16CM48
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

15CM374, 15CM449, 16CM48 cases called at 1:05 pm case called Defendant Joel F. Castillo in court with attorney Raymond E. Schrank.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader-resolution reached on all three matters-no jury trial to be held. DA Blader states agreement on record-Count 1 of 15CM374-Count 1 to Batter w/o Domestic abuse enhancer-940.19(1). Attorney Schrank makes statement to court regarding resolution.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea:  No Contest to Count 1 of 15CM374, No Contest to Count 1 of 15CM449, No Contest to Count 2 & 3 of 16CM48. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 of 15CM374, Count 2 & 3 of 15CM449 and Counts 1 & 4 of 16CM48 and dismiss Domestic Abuse modifier of Count 1 of 15CM374. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Shrank. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 
15CM374-Count 1-20 days WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit fo 15 days served. Concurrent to 15CM449 & 16CM48. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 
15CM449- Count 1-20 days WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 15 days served. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 
16CM48-Count 2 & Count 3- 20 days WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 15 days served. Concurrent to each other & concurrent to 15CM374 & 15CM449.  Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

10:02 am cases called. 15CM374 & 16CM48. Defendant Joel F. Castillo in court with attorney Raymond E. Schrank.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over motion for evidentiary hearing. Both counsel concurs. Statement by ADA Anderson motion. Statement by Attorney Schrank regarding convictions. Court has read the memorandum and determines a prima facia case has been proven and the immigration consequences as a result of the convictions. Court permits case to proceed. Attorney Schrank calls Attorney Jared Redfield, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross by Attorney Anderson. Exhibit #1. Court questions Attorney Redfield. 10:43 witness excused. Attorney Schrank calls Jose F. Castillo, witness sworn, testimony given. Cross exam by Attorney Anderson. 11:08 am witness excused. No further evidence by Attorney Schrank. Court makes statement to counsel. Argument by Attorney Schrank. Argument by ADA Anderson. Further argument by Attorney Schrank. Statement by Court to counsel regarding admonishment. Court grants withdrawal of plea as to the entrity of this agreement and court sets matter.  Jury trial scheduled for January 12, 2017 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

15CM-374 and 16CM-48 - Both Cases Called @ 11:48 AM: Attorney Raymond E. Schrank in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's Waiver of Appearance filed by Atty Schrank prior to going of record.  Argument by ADA - State would object to the motion and more than likely an evidentiary hearing will need to be scheduled absent input from prior counsel.  Argument by Atty Schrank.  The Court:  Finds Defendant has made a prima facie case and that a further Machner hearing will be required.  Judicial notice taken of Mendez case. The standard followed has now grown nebulous.  Defendant to appear via video from Dodge Detention Center - further hearing will be required with Defendant and Interpreter.

15CM-374, 15CM-449 and 16CM-48 - All cases called @ 2:42 PM: Defendant Joel F. Castillo in court with attorney Jared Redfield.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karyn Simmons also present as Interpreter.    Interpreter oath given by the Court.  Global resolution recited by ADA.  16CM-48:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty as to each case.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CM-374 Ct 1 (DC Dom) Plea:  NC  15CM-449 Ct 1 (OAR) Plea:  NC  16CM-48 Ct 2 (FTI IID) Plea:  NC  Ct 3 (BJump) Plea:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  15CM-374 Ct 2 DRI.  15CM-449 Ct Nos 2 and 3 DRI.  15TR-3086 DRI.  16CM-48 Ct Nos 1 and 4 DRI.  Argument as to SEH by ADA - 20 days as to 16CM-48.  Argument as to SEH by Atty Redfield as to request for WCJ on 16CM-48. Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Follows all components of resolution that are joint.  15CM-374: S/W - 2 yrs probation.  Conditions:  Complete either Dom Abuse Program or Anger Mgmt under coordination of his agent - availability of program may be a challenge based upon language barrier; no argumentative contact with E.M.; Court costs including DNA surcharge and sample.   15CM-449:  Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP - DNA Sample ordered.  16CM-48:  15 days WCJ as to each Count - Report - 4/1/2016 at 8:00 PM; Huber, GT no TS credit - concurrent terms as to both counts; Court Costs as to each Count - 60 DTP or PP.   DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Hispanic Appeal Rights Given.  Bond as to each case to be applied as posted - may be sufficient to cover financial obligations with any refund to Poster.  Def resides in Adams Co now.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-01-2016 02:15 pm

15CM-374 and 15CM-449 - Both Cases Called @ 2:50 PM: Defendant Joel F. Castillo in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath admininstered at previous hearing today.  Court has been made aware that Def will be represented by Atty Jared Redfield as to this case and the other pending matter.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def confirms he will be represented by Atty Redfield.    NGP entered by the Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference at 12-01-2015 02:30 pm

Case Called @ 3:28 PM: Defendant Joel F. Castillo in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at prior proceeding today.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel.  Employed full time.  Based upon earnings the Court does not believe that Def will qualify.  Def referred anyway to SPD based upon dependents for eligiblity.
